title: Dataset ingestion
content: Use the dataset agent to combine JSON logs into `data/dataset.csv` with the expected schema. Normalize metadata fields (mitre, groups, description, win.eventdata) and de-duplicate rows after ingestion.
commands: python -m thesis dataset --database data/dataset.csv --fields timestamp eventid description win.eventdata --logs data/input.json --dedup

title: Rule generation via Ollama
content: Give the agent the Wazuh detection goal, existing rules, and example logs. You can read existing rules from `data/local_rules.xml` and use `--logs data/annotation_logs/<id>.json` to provide context.
commands: python -m thesis rule --client ollama --detection-goal "Detect suspicious process" --existing-rules data/local_rules.xml --logs data/annotation_logs/example.json

title: Offline LoRA generation
content: If you trained the LoRA adapter (`wazuh-specialized`), load it with the local transformer client to answer the same prompts while staying offline.
commands: python -m thesis rule --client local --local-adapter wazuh-specialized --local-base-model Qwen/Qwen2.5-3B --detection-goal "Detect suspicious process" --existing-rules data/local_rules.xml --logs data/annotation_logs/example.json
